intro: Tournefortia earlei, commonly known as the Hawaiian tournefortia, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a shrub that typically grows in coastal areas and is well adapted to the tropical climate. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, and its leaves are usually opposite and elliptical in shape. It is part of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
